Bonds led a controversial career, notably as a central figure in baseball'sBanned substances in baseball in the United Statessteroids scandal. In 2007, he was indicted on charges ofperjuryandobstruction of justicefor allegedly lying to the grand jury during the federal government's investigation ofBay Area Laboratory Co-OperativeBALCO. The perjury charges against Bonds were dropped, but he was convicted of obstruction of justice.cite newshttp://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/04/barry-bonds-verdict-.htmlBarry Bonds convicted of obstruction of justice in performance-enhancing-drugs case2011-04-162011-04-13[[Los Angeles Times]]https://web.archive.org/web/20110428145119/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/04/barry-bonds-verdict-.html28 April 2011nocite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBarry Bonds found guilty of obstruction2011-04-162011-04-14[[ESPN]]https://web.archive.org/web/20110429233138/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id29 April 2011nocite newshttp://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/mlb/2013/09/13/barry-bonds-obstruction-of-justice-conviction-upheld/2809745/USA TODAY SportsBarry Bonds' obstruction conviction upheld2013-09-13cite webhttp://www.mercurynews.com/crime-courts/ci_26553809/barry-bonds-case-court-rehear-home-run-kingsBarry Bonds case: Court to rehear home-run king's appeal2014-09-182014-09-18[[San Jose Mercury News]]Mintz, HowardThis conviction was upheld by an appellate court panel in 2013, but after a rehearing, a larger panel of the court voted 10-1 to overturn his conviction in 2015.cite newsEgelkoBobhttp://www.sfgate.com/crime/article/Appeals-court-overturns-Barry-Bonds-6217365.phpAppeals court overturns Barry Bonds' obstruction conviction[[San Francisco Chronicle]]April 22, 20142015-04-23

article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Born inRiverside, Californiato former major leaguerBobby Bondsand the former Patricia Howard,cite webhttp://www.britannica.com/eb/article-9384072/Barry-Bonds#759273.hook2007-09-25Barry BondsEncyclopædia Britannica Online2007Bonds grew up inSan Carlos, Californiaand attendedJunpero Serra High School (San Mateo, California)Junpero Serra High SchoolinSan Mateo, Californiaand excelled inbaseball,basketballandAmerican footballfootball. He played on thejunior varsity teamduring his freshman year and the remainder of his high school career on thevarsity team. He batted for a .467 batting averagehis senior year, and was named prepAll-American.cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/team/player_career.jsp?player_id2007-09-082007Player Profile: Barry Bonds 25[[MLB.com]]The Giants drafted Bonds in the second round of the1982 Major League Baseball Draft1982 MLB draftas a high school senior,cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/b/bondsba01.shtmlBarry Bonds Statistics[[Baseball-Reference]]2007-11-032007-10-28https://web.archive.org/web/20071030141637/http://www.baseball-reference.com/b/bondsba01.shtml30 October 2007nobut the Giants and Bonds were unable to agree on contract terms whenTom Haller's maximum offer was $70,000 ($formatnum:today) and Bond's minimum to go pro was $75,000, so Bonds instead decided to attend college.cite webhttp://bleacherreport.com/articles/284885-the-san-francisco-giants-drafting-barry-bonds-in-19822010-09-112009-11-05The San Francisco Giants Drafting Barry Bonds In 1982[[Bleacher Report]]Christensen, Arne
article.heading: College career
article.paragraph: Bonds attendedArizona State University, hitting .347 with 45 home runs and 175 runs batted in(RBI).In 1984 he batted .360 and had 30 stolen bases. In 1985 he hit 23 home runs with 66 RBIs and a .368 batting average. He was aSporting NewsAll-American selection that year. He tied theNCAArecord with seven consecutive hits in theCollege World Seriesas sophomore and was named to All-Time College World Series Team in 1996.He graduated from Arizona State in 1986 with a degree incriminology. He was named ASU On Deck Circle Most Valuable Player; other winners includeDustin Pedroia,Willie Bloomquist,Paul Lo Duca, andIke Davis.cite webhttp://www.cstv.com/sports/m-basebl/stories/052808aaa.html#1 in College SportsCSTV.comMay 27, 2008May 14, 2010During college, he played part of one summer in the amateurAlaska Baseball Leaguewith theAlaska Goldpanners.
article.heading: Professional career
Draft and minor leagues
article.paragraph: ThePittsburgh Piratesdrafted Bonds as the sixth overall pick of the1985 Major League Baseball Draft.He joined thePotomac NationalsPrince William Piratesof theCarolina Leagueand was named July 1985 Player of the Month for the league.cite bookFinoliDavidRainerBillThe Pittsburgh Pirates Encyclopediahttp://books.google.com/books?idSeptember 12, 20102003Sports Publishing LLCUnited States978-1-58261-416-8262Inbaseball year1986, he hit .311 in 44 games for theHawaii Islandersof thePacific Coast League.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/minors/player.cgi?idBarry Bonds minor league statistics & history2010-09-12[[Baseball-Reference.com]]
article.heading: Pittsburgh Pirates (198692)
article.paragraph: File:Bondsasapittsburghpirate.jpgthumbrightBonds as a Pittsburgh PirateBefore Bonds made it to the major leagues in Pittsburgh, Pirate fan attendance was low, with 1984 and 1985 attendance below 10,000 per game for the 81-game home schedule.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/1988/07/24/sports/baseball-young-pirates-bring-out-that-old-fan-spirit.html2010-09-141988-07-24[[The New York Times]]Baseball; Young Pirates Bring Out That Old Fan SpiritMoran, MalcolmBonds made his major league debut on May 30, 1986.In 1986, Bonds ledNational League(NL) rookies with 16 home runs, 48 RBI, 36 stolen bases and 65 walks, but he finished 6th inMajor League Baseball Rookie of the Year AwardRookie of the Yearvoting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1986.shtml#NLroy1986 National League Rookie of the Year Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080415192415/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1986.shtml15 April 2008noHe playedcenter fieldin 1986, but switched toleft fieldwith the arrival of centerfielderAndy Van Slykein 1987.

In his early years, Bonds batted as theleadoff hitter.cite webhttp://trib.com/sports/article_ddbf3f8f-d5d1-5045-8b68-7ed2ea56123e.htmlBarry Bonds: How a prospect became baseball's premier player2010-09-142004-08-13[[Casper Star-Tribune]]Meyer, PaulWith Van Slyke also in the outfield, the Pirates had a venerable defensive tandem that worked together to cover a lot of ground on the field although they were not close off the field.The Pirates experienced a surge in fan enthusiasm with Bonds on the team and set the club attendance record of 52,119 in the 1987 home opener.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/1988/04/12/sports/baseball-pirates-top-phillies-set-crowd-record.html2010-09-141988-04-12[[The New York Times]]Baseball; Pirates Top Phillies; Set Crowd Record[[Associated Press]]That year, he hit 25 home runs in his second season, along with 32 stolen bases and 59 RBIs.

Bonds improved in 1988, hitting .283 with 24 home runs.The Pirates broke the record set the previous year with 54,089 attending the home opener.Bonds now fit into a highly respected lineup featuringBobby Bonilla, Van Slyke andJay Bell.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res2010-09-142007-01-07[[The New York Times]]An Appreciation; Worth Watching, From Start to FinishKepner, TylerHe finished with 19 homers, 58 RBIs, and 14 outfieldassist (baseball)assistsin 1989, which was second in the NL.cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/team/player_career.jsp?player_id2008-04-162007Player Profile: Barry Bonds 25 (1989)[[MLB.com]]Following the season, rumors that he would be traded to theLos Angeles DodgersforJeff Hamilton (baseball)Jeff HamiltonandJohn Wetteland, but the team denied the rumors and no such trade occurred.cite webhttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idBucs Won't Send Bonds To Dodgers2010-09-141989-12-22[[Lawrence Journal-World]]cite webhttp://news.google.com/newspapers?idPirates Deny Barry Bonds To Be Traded To Dodgers2010-09-141989-12-22[[Gainesville Sun]]

Bonds won his firstMLB MVPMVPaward in 1990,cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1990.shtml#NLmvp1990 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080415185017/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1990.shtml15 April 2008nohitting .301 with 33 home runs and 114 RBIs. He also stole 52 bases, which were third in the league, to become a first-time member of the30-30 club. He won his firstGold GloveandSilver SluggerAwards.That year, the Pirates won theNational League Easttitle for their first postseason berth since winning the1979 World Series. However, theCincinnati Reds(whose last post-season berth had also been in 1979; they lost to the Pirates in1979 National League Championship Seriesthat year's NLCS) defeated the Pirates in the1990 National League Championship SeriesNLCSen route to winning the1990 World SeriesWorld Championship.

In 1991, Bonds also put up great numbers, hitting 25 homers and driving in 116 runs, and obtained another Gold Glove and Silver Slugger. He finished second to theAtlanta Braves'Terry Pendleton(the NL batting champion) in the MVP voting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1991.shtml#NLmvp1991 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080410103618/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1991.shtml10 April 2008noThe Pirates slugging outfield of Bonds, Bonilla and Van Slyke performed miserably in the 1990 and 1991 playoffs hitting .190 in 1990 (12 for 63) and .200 in 1991 (15 for 75).cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/1991/10/19/sports/baseball-the-3-aarghs-bonds-van-slyke-and-bonilla.htmlBaseball; The 3 Aarghs: Bonds, Van Slyke and Bonilla2010-09-141991-10-19[[The New York Times]]Chass, Murray

In March 1992, Pirates general managerTed Simmonsagreed to a deal with Atlanta Braves counterpartJohn Schuerholzto trade Bonds, in exchange forAlejandro Pea,Keith Mitchell (baseball)Keith Mitchell, and a player to be named later. Pirates managerJim Leylandopposed the trade vehemently, and the proposal was rescinded.cite newsChassMurrayBefore Balco, Bonds Was Almost a Bravehttp://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/11/sports/baseball/11chass.htmlOctober 13, 2015New York TimesMarch 11, 2006Bonds stayed with Pittsburgh and won his second MVP award that season.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1992.shtml#NLmvp1992 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080406011331/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1992.shtml6 April 2008noWhile hitting .311 with 34 homers and 103 RBIs, he propelled the Pirates to their third straightNational League Eastdivision title. However, Pittsburgh was defeated by the Braves in a seven-game1992 National League Championship SeriesNational League Championship Series. Bonds participated in the final play of1992 National League Championship Series Game 7Game 7of the NLCS, whereby he fielded a base hit byFrancisco Cabrera (baseball)Francisco Cabreraand attempted to throw outSid Breamat home plate. But the throw to Pirates catcherMike LaVallierewas late and Bream scored the winning run.cite webhttp://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/baseballs_best/mlb_bb_gamepage.jsp?story_pageSid Bream's modern-day "mad dash" wins the pennant for Atlanta2007-09-081992-10-14[[MLB.com]]https://web.archive.org/web/20071013075653/http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/baseballs_best/mlb_bb_gamepage.jsp?story_page13 October 2007noFor the third consecutive season, the NL East Champion Pirates were denied a trip to the World Series. Following the loss, Bonds and star teammateDoug Drabekwere expected to command salaries too high for Pittsburgh to again sign them.cite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/1992/10/16/sports/sports-of-the-times-the-pirates-lost-a-series-not-respect.htmlSports of The Times; The Pirates Lost a Series, Not Respect2010-09-141992-10-16[[The New York Times]]Vecsey, Georgecite newsNewhanRossNo Complaints : Jim Leyland Has Lost the Heart of His Team, but the Pirates' Manager Is Taking It in Stridehttp://articles.latimes.com/1993-03-21/sports/sp-13655_1_jim-leyland/2October 13, 2015Los Angeles TimesMarch 21, 1993
article.heading: San Francisco Giants (19932007)
1993 season
article.paragraph: In 1993, Bonds left the Pirates to sign a lucrativefree agentcontract worth a then-record $43.75 million ($formatnum:million today) over six years with the Giants, with whom his father had spent the first seven years of his career, and with whom his godfatherWillie Maysplayed 22 of his 24 Major League seasons. The deal was at that time the largest in baseball history, in terms of both total value and average annual salary.cite newsChass, Murrayhttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resGiants Make Investment: $43 Million in Bonds[[The New York Times]]1992-12-062008-01-31

Once he signed with the Giants, Bonds had intended to wear 24, his number during most of his stay with the Pirates, and after receiving Mays' blessing the Giants were willing to unretire it until the public commotion from fans and media became too much.cite newshttp://articles.sfgate.com/2007-09-23/news/17263404_1_giants-uniform-willie-mays-number-performance-enhancing-drugsDid Giants' special treatment of Bonds contribute to messy end?: Pampered slugger delivered, but there was a big downside2010-09-142007-09-23[[San Francisco Chronicle]]Shea, Johncite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idLove Me, Hate Me: Barry Bonds and the Making of an Antihero2008-04-17HarperCollinsPearlman, Jeff978-0-06-079752-2To honor his father, Bonds switched his jersey number to 25, as it had been Bobby's number in San Francisco.cite webhttp://www.thebaseballpage.com/players/bondsba01.phpBarry Bonds2010-09-14The Baseball Page

Bonds hit .336 in 1993, leading the league with 46 home runs and 123 RBI en route to his second consecutive MVP award,cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1993.shtml#NLmvp1993 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080414172552/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1993.shtml14 April 2008noand third overall. As good as the Giants were (winning 103 games), theAtlanta Braveswon 104 in what some call the last great pennant race (due to the Wild Card being instituted shortly after).cite webhttp://espn.go.com/classic/s/2001/0927/1255891.htmlESPN.comWhat makes a great Pennant Race?2007-09-252001-10-01Neyer, Rob
article.heading: 1994 season
article.paragraph: In the lockout-shortened season of 1994, Bonds hit .312 with 37 home runs and a league-leading 74 walks,and he finished 4th in MVP voting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1994.shtml#NLmvp1994 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080509144628/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1994.shtml9 May 2008no
article.heading: 1995 season
article.paragraph: Inbaseball year1995, Bonds hit 33 homers and drove in 104 runs, hitting .294 but finished only 12th in MVP voting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1995.shtml#NLmvp1995 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080418061553/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1995.shtml18 April 2008noIn 1994, he appeared in a small role as himself in the television filmJane's House, starringJames WoodsandAnne Archer.cite newsEverettToddReview: ‘Cbs Sunday Movie Jane’s House’http://variety.com/1993/tv/reviews/cbs-sunday-movie-jane-s-house-1200434607/October 22, 2015VarietyDecember 28, 1993cite journalLeonardJohnThe Sporting Goods LifeNew YorkJanuary 3, 199427154https://books.google.com/books?id
article.heading: 1996 season
article.paragraph: File:Barrybonds1.JPGrightthumbBonds in the field.In 1996, Bonds became the first National League player and second (of the current list of four) major league player(s) to hit 40 home runs and steal 40 bases in the same season.cite webhttp://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/history/rare_feats/index.jsp?featureThe 40–40 Club: (Recorded 40 HRs and 40 SBs in a single season)[[MLB.com]]September 11, 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20100825094135/http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/history/rare_feats/index.jsp?feature25 August 2010noThe other members of the4040 clubareJos Canseco1988,Alex Rodriguez1998, andAlfonso Soriano2006; his father Bobby Bonds was one home run short in 1973 when he hit 39 home runs and stole 43 bases.cite newshttp://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/09/16/AR2006091600674.htmlSoriano Reaches 40–40 Mark2008-04-172006-09-17Goff, Steven[[The Washington Post]]

Bonds hit his 300th and 301st home runs off theFlorida Marlins'John Burketton April 27.He became the fourth player in history to join the 300300 club with 300 stolen bases and 300 home runs for a career, joiningWillie Mays,Andre Dawson, and his father. Bonds' totals for the season included 129 runs driven in, a .308 average and a then-National League record 151 walks.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resBaseball: Bonds loses rage, but not the swing2008-04-171996-05-17[[The New York Times]]Smith, ClaireHe finished fifth in the MVP balloting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1996.shtml#NLmvp1996 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080422062343/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1996.shtmlApril 22, 2008no
article.heading: 1997 season
article.paragraph: In 1997 Bonds hit .291, his lowest average since 1989. He hit 40 home runs for the second straight year and drove in 101 runs, leading the league in walks again with 145.He tied his father in 1997 for having the most 30/30 seasons, and he again placed fifth in the MVP balloting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1997.shtml#NLmvp1997 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080409140334/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1997.shtmlApril 9, 2008no
article.heading: 1998 season
article.paragraph: With two outs in the 9th inning of a game against the Arizona Diamondbacks on May 28, 1998, Bonds became only the fifth player in baseball history to be given anintentional walkwith the bases loaded.Nap Lajoie(1901 in baseball1901),Del Bissonette(1928 in baseball1928) andBill Nicholson (baseball)Bill Nicholson(1944 in baseball1944) were three others in the 20th century who received that rare honor. The first to receive one wasAbner Dalrymplein1881 in baseball1881.cite webhttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/recbooks/rb_wk3.shtmlIntentional bases on balls records2008-04-22[[Baseball Almanac]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080413105030/http://www.baseball-almanac.com/recbooks/rb_wk3.shtml13 April 2008noDuring a game against thePhiladelphia Phillieson August 2, Bonds was hit by a pitch thrown byRicky Bottalico, leading to Bonds charging the mound and triggering abench-clearing brawl.

On August 23, Bonds hit his 400th career home run. By doing so, he became the first player ever to enter the 400400 club by having career totals of 400 home runs and 400 stolen bases. The milestone home run came offKirt Ojala, who, like Burkett, was pitching for the Marlins.cite webhttp://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/sf/history/sf_history_timeline_article.jsp?article1996: Bonds bashes, runs into history2008-04-17[[MLB.com]]Giants timelinehttps://web.archive.org/web/20080515213301/http://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/sf/history/sf_history_timeline_article.jsp?articleMay 15, 2008noFor the season, he hit .303 with 37 home runs and drove in 122 runs, winning his eighth Gold Glove,He finished 8th in the MVP voting.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1998.shtml#NLmvp1998 National League Most Valuable Player Award2008-04-16[[Baseball-Reference]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080414172557/http://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/awards_1998.shtml14 April 2008no
article.heading: 1999 season
article.paragraph: File:BarryLamar Bonds.jpgthumbrightBonds at the plate with the Giants.Bill Jamesranked Bonds as the best player of the 1990s. He added that the decade's second-best player,Craig Biggio,cite webhttp://statisticianmagician.mlblogs.com/archives/2008/02/james_on_biggio.htmlJames on Biggio, Me on James2008-04-172008-02-27https://web.archive.org/web/20080415165349/http://statisticianmagician.mlblogs.com/archives/2008/02/james_on_biggio.htmlApril 15, 2008nohad been closer in production to the decade's 10th-best player than to Bonds. In 1999, with statistics through 1997 being considered, Bonds ranked Number 34 on The Sporting News' list of the 100 Greatest Baseball Players, making him the highest-ranking active player.cite webhttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/legendary/lisn100.shtmlBaseball's 100 Greatest Players2008-04-17[[Baseball Almanac]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080512031751/http://baseball-almanac.com/legendary/lisn100.shtmlMay 12, 2008no

When the Sporting News list was redone in 2005, Bonds was ranked 6th behind Babe Ruth, Willie Mays,Ty Cobb,Walter Johnson, andHank Aaron. Bonds was omitted from 1999's Major League Baseball All-Century Team, to whichKen Griffey, Jr.was elected.cite webhttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/legendary/limc100.shtmlAll Century Team2008-04-17[[Baseball Almanac]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080513145608/http://baseball-almanac.com/legendary/limc100.shtmlMay 13, 2008noJames wrote of Bonds, "Certainly the most unappreciated superstar of my lifetime. ... Griffey has always been more popular, but Bonds has been a far, far greater player." In 1999, he rated Bonds as the 16th-best player of all time. "When people begin to take in all of his accomplishments", he predicted, "Bonds may well be rated among the five greatest players in the history of the game."cite bookThe New Bill James Historical Baseball AbstractThe Free PressNew York2003James, Bill0-7432-2722-0as cited atcite webhttp://www.efqreview.com/NewFiles/v21n1/books-fivebooks.htmlFive Books for a Deserted IslandChristensen, Chris2008-04-172006Elysian Fields Quarterly
article.heading: 2000 season
article.paragraph: In 2000, the following year, Bonds hit .306 with career bests through that time in both slugging percentage (.688) and home runs (49) in just 143 games. He also drew a league-leading 117 walks.
article.heading: 2001 season
article.paragraph: The next year, Bonds' offensive production reached even higher levels, breaking not only his own personal records but several major league records. In the Giants' first 50 games in 2001, he hit 28 home runs, including 17 in Maya career high.cite webhttp://www.sportsline.com/mlb/bondstracker/bondslogBonds career HR log2007-09-25[[CBS Sports]]https://web.archive.org/web/20070923104248/http://sportsline.com/mlb/bondstracker/bondslog23 September 2007noThis early stretch included his 500th home run hit on April 17 againstTerry Adams (baseball)Terry Adamsof theLos Angeles Dodgers.cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/boxes/SFN/SFN200104170.shtmlApr 17, 2001, Dodgers at Giants play by play and box score2001-04-172010-08-06Baseball Referencecite newshttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/baseball/mlb/news/2001/10/05/bonds_71_ap/Bonds hits 71st, 72nd homers as Giants get eliminated2010-08-06[[Sports Illustrated]]2001-10-05yeshttps://web.archive.org/20100110000839/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com:80/baseball/mlb/news/2001/10/05/bonds_71_ap/10 January 2010He also hit 39 home runs by the All-star break (a major league record), drew a major league record 177 walks, and had a .515 on-base average, a feat not seen since Mickey Mantle and Ted Williams over forty years earlier. Bonds' slugging percentage was a major league record .863cite bookGuinness World Records2322007[[HiT Entertainment]]London; New York City978-0-9735514-4-0(411 total bases in 476 at-bats), and, most impressively, he ended the season with a major league record 73 home runs.cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/team/player_career.jsp?player_id2008-04-172007Player Profile: Barry Bonds 25 (2001)[[MLB.com]]

On October 4, Bonds tied the previous record of 70 set byMark McGwirewhich McGwire set in the 162nd game in 1998 by homering offWilfredo Rodrguezin the 159th game of the season.cite webhttp://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/mlb/events/mlb_bonds_hr_info.jsp2001 Home Run Tracker2010-08-06[[MLB.com]]He then hit numbers 71 and 72 the following night offChan Ho Park. Bonds added his 73rd offDennis Springeron October 7.The ball was later sold to toy manufacturer Todd McFarlane for $450,000. He previously bought Mark McGwire's 70th home run ball from 1998.cite newshttp://articles.cnn.com/2002-10-16/justice/ctv.baseball.lawsuit_1_martin-triano-alex-popov-patrick-hayashi?_s2010-10-04Barry BondsCNN2002-10-07Bonds received theBabe Ruth Home Run Awardfor leading MLB in homers that season.cite newsSykenBillConspicuous absenceMay 9, 2006SI.comhttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2006/baseball/mlb/05/08/bonds.ruth/http://www.webcitation.org/633T2G7h6November 8, 2011
article.heading: 2002 season
article.paragraph: Bonds re-signed with the Giants for a five-year, $90 million contract in January 2002.cite newshttp://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-49533870.htmlBonds agrees to dlrs 90 million, five-year contract with GiantsJanuary 15, 2002Associated PressSeptember 11, 2010He hit five home runs in the Giants' first four games of the season, tyingLou Brock's 35-year record for most home runs after four games. He won the NL batting title with a career-high .370 average and struck out only 47 times.cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/team/player_career.jsp?player_id2008-04-172007Player Profile: Barry Bonds 25 (2002)[[MLB.com]]He hit 46 home runs in 403 at-bats.

Despite playing in nine fewer games than the previous season, he drew 198 walks, a major-league record; 68 of them were intentional walks, surpassingWillie McCovey's 45 inBaseball year1969for another Major League record. He slugged .799, then the fourth-highest total all time. Bonds broke Ted Williams' major league record for on-base average with .582. Bonds also hit his 600th home run, less than a year and a half after hitting his 500th.The home run came on August 9 at home againstKip Wellsof the Pirates.cite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/boxscore?gameIdPittsburgh Pirates at San Francisco Giants (box score)2002-08-092010-08-06ESPN.comcite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdBonds' 600th blast not enough to beat Bucs2002-08-092010-08-06ESPN.com
article.heading: 2002 postseason
article.paragraph: Bonds batted .322 with 8 home runs, 16 RBI, and 27 walks in the postseason en route to the2002 World Serieswhere the Giants lost the series 43 to theAnaheim Angels.
article.heading: 2003 season
article.paragraph: In 2003, Bonds played in just 130 games. He hit 45 home runs in just 390 at-bats, along with a .341 batting average. He slugged .749, walked 148 times, and had an on-base average well over .500 (.529) for the third straight year.He also became the only member of the career 500 home run/500 stolen base club by stealing second base on June 23 off of pitcherric Gagnin the 11th inning of a tied ball game against theLos Angeles Dodgers(against whom Bonds had tallied his 500th home run). Bonds scored the game-winning run later that inning.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdBonds' big night steals win for Giants2008-04-172003-06-23ESPN.com
article.heading: 2004 season
article.paragraph: In 2004, Bonds had perhaps his best season. He hit .362 en route to his second National League batting title, and broke his own record by walking 232 times. He slugged .812, which was fourth-highest of all time, and broke his on-base percentage record with a .609 average. Bonds passed Mays on the career home run list by hitting his 661st off ofBen Ford (baseball)Ben Fordon April 13,cite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdBonds hits solo shot in seventh off Ford2004-04-132010-08-06ESPNcite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/boxscore?gameIdMilwaukee Brewers at San Francisco Giants (box score)2004-04-132010-08-06ESPN.comHe then hit his 700th off ofJake Peavyon September 17.cite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/boxscore?gameIdSan Diego Padres at San Francisco Giants (box score)2004-09-172010-08-06ESPN.comcite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdGiants hold half-game lead on Cubs2004-09-172010-08-06ESPN.comBonds hit 45 home runs in 373 at-bats, and struck out just 41 times, putting himself in elite company, as few major leaguers have ever had more home runs than strikeouts in a season. Bonds would win his fourth consecutive MVP award and his seventh overall.cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/team/player_career.jsp?player_id2008-04-172007Player Profile: Barry Bonds 25 (2004)[[MLB.com]]His seven MVP awards are four more than any other player in history. In addition, no other player from either league has been awarded the MVP four times in a row.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/classic/bio/news/story?pageBonds: The Unpopular Home Run Champ2008-04-172007-08-08Carter, BobESPN.com(The MVP award was first given in 1931). On July 4, he tied and passedRickey Henderson's career bases on balls record with his 2190th and 2191st career walks.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-192004-07-04ESPN.comBradford, Mulder both walk slugger

As Bonds neared Aaron's record, Aaron was called on for his opinion of Bonds. He clarified that he was a fan and admirer of Bonds and avoided the controversy regarding whether the record should be denoted with an asterisk due to Bonds' alleged steroid usage. He felt recognition and respect for the award was something to be determined by the fans.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resSports of The Times; Aaron Will Let the Fans Judge Bonds2008-05-272004-04-07[[The New York Times]]Anderson, DaveAs the steroid controversy received greater media attention during the offseason before the 2005 season, Aaron expressed some reservations about the statements Bonds made on the issue. Aaron expressed that he felt drug and steroid use to boost athletic performance was inappropriate. Aaron was frustrated that the media could not focus on events that occurred in the field of play and wished drugs or gambling allegations such as those associated withPete Rosecould be emphasized less.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idHOF and asterisks not up to Aaron2008-05-272004-12-06ESPN.comIn 2007, Aaron felt the whole steroid use issue was very controversial and decided that he would not attend any possible record-breaking games.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idIf Bonds breaks HR record, Aaron 'won't be there'2008-05-272007-05-22ESPN.comAaron congratulated Bonds through the media when Bonds broke Aaron's record.cite newshttp://www.usatoday.com/sports/baseball/2007-08-08-bonds-756_N.htmBonds blasts No. 756 to take over top spot2008-05-272007-08-07[[USA Today]]Nightengale, Bob
article.heading: 2005 season
article.paragraph: Bonds' salary for the 2005 season was $22 million, the second-highest salary in Major League Baseball (theNew York YankeesYankees'Alex Rodriguezearned the highest, $25.2 million).cite webhttp://www.baseball-reference.com/leaders/leaders_salaries.shtmlHighest Career Total and Single-Season Salaries2007-09-29[[Baseball-Reference]]2007-09-27https://web.archive.org/web/20070929153252/http://www.baseball-reference.com/leaders/leaders_salaries.shtml29 September 2007noBonds endured a knee injury, multiple surgeries, and rehabilitation. He was activated on September 12 and started in left field. In his return against theSan Diego Padres, he nearly hit a home run in his first at-bat. Bonds finished the night 1-for-4.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdGiant comeback: Bonds 1-for-4 in winning return2008-04-172005-09-12ESPN.comUpon his return, Bonds resumed his high-caliber performance at the plate, hitting home runs in four consecutive games from September 18 to September 21 and finishing with five homers in only 14 games.
article.heading: 2006 season
article.paragraph: File:Barry Bonds3.jpgthumbBonds batting against the Chicago Cubs in 2006In 2006, Bonds earned $20 million (not including bonuses), the fourth highest salary in baseball. Through the 2006 season he had earned approximately $172 million during his then 21-year career, making him baseball's all-time highest paid player.Bonds hit under .200 for his first 10 games of the season and did not hit a home run until April 22. This 10-game stretch was his longest home run slump since the 1998 season.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameIdBonds goes opposite field for career No. 7092008-04-172006-04-22ESPN.comOn May 7, Bonds drew within one home run of tying Babe Ruth for second place on the all-time list, hitting his 713th career home run into the second level ofCitizens Bank ParkinPhiladelphia, off pitcherJon Lieberin a game in which the Giants lost to thePhiladelphia Phillies.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-022006-05-07Amidst Bonds spectacle, Phillies win eighth straightESPN.comThe towering home runone of the longest in Citizens Bank Park's two-season history, traveling an estimated 450 feet (140 m)hit off the facade of the third deck in right field.

On May 20, Bonds tied Ruth, hitting his 714th career home run to deep right field to lead off the top of the 2nd inning.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-022006-05-20Bonds reels in Babe, blasts home run No. 714ESPN.comThe home run came off left-handed pitcherBrad Halseyof theOakland AthleticsOakland A's, in aninterleague playinterleaguegame played inOakland, California. Since this was an interleague game at an American League stadium, Bonds was batting as thedesignated hitterin the lineup for the Giants. Bonds was quoted after the game as being "glad it's over with"cite webhttp://barrybonds.mlb.com/news/article.jsp?ymdBonds ties Ruth with homer No. 7142006-05-20[[MLB.com]]2007-12-14https://web.archive.org/web/20080102054956/http://barrybonds.mlb.com/news/article.jsp?ymd2 January 2008noand stated that more attention could be focused onAlbert Pujols, who was on a very rapid home run pace in early 2006.

double imageleftSign_counts_down_to_Barry_Bonds_713th_home_run.jpg125DSCN0163 Bonds715.JPG133A sign counts up to Barry Bonds' 714th home runConcession stand where home run number 715 was hit in center fieldOn May 28, Bonds passed Ruth, hitting his 715th career home run to center field offColorado RockiespitcherByung-Hyun Kim.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-022006-05-28Bonds' milestone homer not enough vs. RockiesESPN.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070702004922/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2 July 2007nocite webhttp://www.sportsline.com/mlb/gamecenter/recap/MLB_20060528_COL@SF2007-09-292006-05-28Bonds hits No. 715, passes Ruth as Giants fall to RockiesCBS Interactive Inc.Miller, ScottThe ball was hit an estimated 445 feet (140 m) into center field where it went through the hands of several fans but then fell onto an elevated platform in center field. Then it rolled off the platform where Andrew Morbitzer, a 38-year-old San Francisco resident, caught the ball while he was in line at a concession stand.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?fTHE BALL:He went for peanuts, and came back with a chance for a fortune2008-04-172006-05-29Estrella, Cicero A., and Tanya Schevitz[[San Francisco Chronicle]]Mysteriously, radio broadcasterDave Flemming's radio play-by-play of the home run went silent just as the ball was hit, apparently from a microphone failure. But the televised version, called by Giants broadcasterDuane Kuiper, was not affected.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id2008-04-182006-05-29Giants' radio call cuts out just as Bonds hits No. 715ESPN.com

File:20060825 Barry Bonds follow through.jpgthumbBonds in August 2006 with the GiantsOn September 22, Bonds tied Henry Aaron's National League career home run record of 733. The home run came in the top of the 6th inning of a high-scoring game against the Milwaukee Brewers, atMiller Park (Milwaukee)Miller Parkin Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The achievement was notable for its occurrence in the very city where Aaron began (with the Milwaukee Braves) and concluded (with the Brewers, then in the American League) his career. With the Giants trailing 108, Bonds hit a blast to deep center field on a 20 pitch off the Brewers'Chris Spurlingwith runners on first and second and one out. Though the Giants were at the time clinging to only a slim chance of making the playoffs, Bonds' home run provided the additional drama of giving the Giants an 1110 lead late in a critical game in the final days of a pennant race. The Brewers eventually won the game, 1312, despite Bonds' going 3 for 5, with 2 doubles, the record-tying home run, and 6 runs batted in.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-022006-09-22Bonds ties Aaron's NL HR mark, but Giants fall to BrewersESPN.com

On September 23, Bonds surpassed Aaron for the NL career home run record. Hit in Milwaukee like the previous one, this was a solo home run offChris Capuanoof the Brewers.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-07-022006-09-23Bonds hits NL-record 734th HR, but Giants lose againESPN.comThis was the last home run Bonds hit in 2006. In 2006, Bonds recorded his lowestslugging percentage(a statistic that he has historically ranked among league leaders season after season) since 1991 with thePittsburgh Pirates.

In January 2007, theNew York Daily Newsreported that Bonds had tested positive foramphetamines.cite newshttp://www.nypost.com/seven/01112007/sports/report__bonds_used_speed_sports_.htm2007-09-04Report: Bonds used 'speed'2007-01-11[[New York Post]]yeshttps://web.archive.org/20070128223550/http://www.nypost.com:80/seven/01112007/sports/report__bonds_used_speed_sports_.htm28 January 2007Under baseball's amphetamine policy, which had been in effect for one season, players testing positive were to submit to six additional tests and undergo treatment and counseling.The policy also stated that players were not to be identified for a first positive test, but theNew York Daily Newsleaked the test's results.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id2007-09-042007-01-11Report: Bonds failed amphetamine testESPN.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070818025425/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id18 August 2007noWhen the Players Association informed Bonds of the test results, he initially attributed it to a substance he had taken from the locker of Giants teammateMark Sweeney,cite newshttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2007/baseball/mlb/01/11/bonds.amphetamines/index.html2007-09-042007-01-11Caught in the actQuinn, T.J.[[SI.com]]yeshttps://web.archive.org/20070125145544/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com:80/2007/baseball/mlb/01/11/bonds.amphetamines/index.html?25 January 2007but would later retract this claim and publicly apologize to Sweeney.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/sports/article/Sweeney-It-s-over-and-done-Giants-don-t-2616226.php2007-09-042007-02-20Sweeney: It's 'over and done': Giants don't expect another apology from BondsSchulman, Henry[[San Francisco Chronicle]]https://web.archive.org/web/20070810113048/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f10 August 2007no
article.heading: 2007 season
article.paragraph: File:Barrybonds2.JPGthumbrightBonds at the plate against the Rockies in 2007On January 29, 2007, the Giants finalized a contract with Bonds for the 2007 season.cite webhttp://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/news/article.jsp?ymdBonds, Giants agree to deal2007-01-292007-09-25[[MLB.com]]Bloom, Barry M.https://web.archive.org/web/20071013075713/http://sanfrancisco.giants.mlb.com/news/article.jsp?ymd13 October 2007noAfter the commissioner's office rejected Bonds' one-year, $15.8 million deal because it contained a personal-appearance provision, the team sent revised documents to his agent,Jeff Borris, who stated that "At this time, Barry is not signing the new documents."cite newshttp://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4155/is_20070201/ai_n18626981https://web.archive.org/web/20071013195011/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4155/is_20070201/ai_n186269812007-10-13Agent: Bonds won't sign revised contract right now2007-02-012007-09-25FindArticles[[Chicago Sun-Times]]Bonds signed a revised one-year, $15.8 million contract on February 15 and reported to the Giants' Spring Training camp on time.

Bonds resumed his march to the all-time record early in the 2007 season. After an opening game in which all he had was a first-inning single past third base against a right-shifted infield (immediately followed by a stolen base and then a base-running misjudgment that got him thrown out at home) and a deep out to left field late in the game,cite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidSan Diego 7, San Francisco 0 (recap)2007-04-14[[Yahoo! Inc.]]Associated Press2007-04-03McCauley, Janiehttps://web.archive.org/web/20070406044330/http://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gid6 April 2007noBonds returned the next day, April 4, with another mission. In his first at-bat of the season's second game at the Giants' AT&T Park, Bonds hit aChris Young (pitcher)Chris Young(of the San Diego Padres) pitch just over the wall to the left of straightaway center field for career home run 735.cite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidSan Diego 5, San Francisco 3 (recap)2007-04-14[[Yahoo! Inc.]]Associated Press2007-04-05McCauley, Janiecite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/boxscore?gidSan Diego 5, San Francisco 3 (box score)2007-04-14[[Yahoo! Inc.]]Associated Press2007-04-05This home run put Bonds past the midway point between Ruth and Aaron.

Bonds did not homer again until April 13, when he hit two (736 and 737) in a 3 for 3 night that included 4 RBI against the Pittsburgh Pirates.cite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidSan Francisco 8, Pittsburgh 5 (recap)2007-04-14[[Yahoo! Sports]]Associated Press2007-04-13https://web.archive.org/web/20070416075146/http://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gid16 April 2007noBonds splashed a pitch bySt. Louis CardinalspitcherRyan FranklinintoMcCovey Coveon April 18 for home run 738.cite newsHome Run No. 738 Pictures - CBS Newshttps://www.google.com/search?q2012-09-11[[CBS News]]2007-04-18Home runs number 739 and 740 came in back to back games on April 21 and April 22 against the Arizona Diamondbacks.cite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidSan Francisco 1, Arizona 0 (recap)2007-04-23[[Yahoo! Sports]]Associated Press2007-04-21https://web.archive.org/web/20070423063807/http://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gid23 April 2007nocite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidSan Francisco 2, Arizona 1 (recap)2007-04-23[[Yahoo! Sports]]Associated Press2007-04-22https://web.archive.org/web/20070427052252/http://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gid27 April 2007no

The hype surrounding Bonds' pursuit of the home run record escalated on May 14. On this day, Sports Auction for Heritage (a Dallas-based auction house) offered US$1 million to the fan that caught Bonds' record-breaking 756th-career home run.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id2007-06-302007-05-14Auction house willing to buy 756 ball for $1MESPN.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070517234829/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id17 May 2007noThe million dollar offer was rescinded on June 11 out of concern of fan safety.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id2007-06-302007-06-12Auction house withdraws $1M bounty on No. 756ESPN.comHome run 748 came on Father's Day, June 17, in the final game of a 3-game road series against the Boston Red Sox atFenway Park, where Bonds had never previously played.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-06-302007-06-17Bonds hits first Fenway homer in loss to Red SoxESPN.comWith this homer, Fenway Park became the 36th major league ballpark in which Bonds had hit a home run. He hit aTim Wakefieldknuckleball just over the low fence into the Giant's bullpen in right field. It was his first home run off his former Pittsburgh Pirate teammate, who became the 441st different pitcher to surrender a four-bagger to Bonds. The 750th career home run, hit on June 29, also came off a former teammate:Livn Hernndez.cite webhttp://scores.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-06-302007-06-29Bonds is 5 homers shy of Aaron's mark after loss in 10thESPN.comThe blast came in the 8th inning and at that point tied the game at 33.

On July 19, after a 21 at-bat hitless streak, Bonds hit 2 home runs, numbers 752 and 753, against theChicago Cubs. He went 33 with 2 home runs, 6 RBIs, and a walk on that day.cite newshttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gidChi Cubs 9, San Francisco 8 (recap)2007-07-19[[Yahoo! Sports]]Associated Press2007-07-19McCauley, Janiehttps://web.archive.org/web/20070809081927/http://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/recap?gid9 August 2007noThe struggling last place Giants still lost the game, 98. On July 27, Bonds hit home run 754 againstFlorida MarlinspitcherRick VandenHurk. Bonds was then walked his next 4 at-bats in the game, but a 2-run shot helped the Giants win the game 1210. It marked the first time since he had hit #747 that Bonds had homered in a game the Giants won.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-09-082007-07-27Bonds pulls within one of Aaron's all-time mark with 754th career homerESPN.comOn August 4, Bonds hit a382 foot (116 m)home run againstClay Hensleyof theSan Diego Padresfor home run number 755, tying Hank Aaron's all-time record.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-09-082007-08-04Bonds ties Aaron with No. 755, but Pads win in 12ESPN.comBonds greeted his son, Nikolai, with an extended bear hug after crossing home plate. Bonds greeted his teammates and then his wife, Liz Watson, and daughter Aisha Lynn behind the backstop. Hensley was the 445th different pitcher to give up a home run to Bonds.Ironically, given the cloud of suspicion that surrounded Bonds, the tying home run was hit off a pitcher who'd been suspended by baseball in 2005 for steroid use.cite webhttp://www.signonsandiego.com/sports/padres/20050405-9999-1s5padside.html[[The San Diego Union-Tribune]]List includes four Padres farmhands2010-09-112005-04-05Center, BillHe was walked in his next at bat and eventually scored on a fielder's choice.

On August 7 at 8:51 PMPacific time zonePDT, Bonds hit a435 foot (133 m)home run, his 756th, off a pitch fromMike Bacsik (left-handed pitcher)Mike Bacsikof theWashington Nationals, breaking the all-time career home run record, formerly held byHank Aaron.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/recap?gameId2007-09-082007-08-07Bonds turns page to new era with home run No. 756ESPN.comCoincidentally, Bacsik's father had faced Aaron (as a pitcher for theTexas Rangers (baseball)Texas Rangers) after Aaron had hit his 755th home run. On August 23, 1976, Michael J. Bacsik held Aaron to a single and a fly out to right field. The younger Bacsik commented later, "If my dad had been gracious enough to let Hank Aaron hit a home run, we both would have given up 756."cite newsPitcher's father faced HankAssociated Press2007-08-08[[Lexington Herald-Leader]]B5After hitting the home run, Bonds gave Bacsik an autographed bat.cite webhttp://www.salem-news.com/articles/august082007/bonds_folo_080807.phpBonds New King of Swing After No. 756[[Salem News]]2007-09-29https://web.archive.org/web/20070927051431/http://www.salem-news.com/articles/august082007/bonds_folo_080807.php27 September 2007no

The pitch, the seventh of the at-bat, was a 32 pitch which Bonds hit into the right-center field bleachers. The fan who ended up with the ball, 22-year-old Matt Murphy fromQueens,New York(and aNew York MetsMets fan), was promptly protected and escorted away from the mayhem by a group of San Francisco police officers.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idQueens man in San Francisco for one day catches famous ballESPN.com2007-09-292007-08-09After Bonds finished his home run trot, a ten-minute delay followed, including a brief video by Aaron congratulating Bonds on breaking the record Aaron had held for 33 years,cite webKriegel, Markhttp://msn.foxsports.com/mlb/story/7102950https://web.archive.org/web/20070815203618/http://msn.foxsports.com/mlb/story/71029502007-08-15Bonds' historic journey too good to be true[[Fox Sports (USA)|Fox Sports]]2007-09-292007-08-08and expressing the hope that "the achievement of this record will inspire others to chase their own dreams."Bonds made an impromptu emotional statement on the field, with Willie Mays, his godfather, at his side and thanked his teammates, family and his late father.Bonds sat out the rest of the game.

article.paragraph: On September 21, 2007, the San Francisco Giants confirmed that they would not re-sign Bonds for the 2008 season.The story was first announced on Bonds' own web site earlier that day.cite webhttp://sports.yahoo.com/mlb/news?slugWhere does Barry Bonds go from here?2007-09-212007-09-24[[Yahoo! There was much speculation before the 2008 season about where Bonds might play.cite webhttp://www.sptimes.com/2008/02/25/Rays/Rays_ponder_Bonds_pur.shtmlRays ponder Bonds pursuit: The club has talked about whether to make a pitch for the controversial slugger2008-08-042008-02-25[[St. Petersburg Times]]Topkin, MarcHowever, no one signed him during the 2008 or 2009 seasons.cite newshttp://www.upi.com/Sports_News/2008/11/06/UPI_NewsTrack_Sports/UPI-32251226030400/Bonds wants federal charges droppedUnited Press International2010-09-112008-11-06cite newshttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2009/writers/michael_mccann/03/16/bonds.collusion/index.htmlUnsigned and unwanted: Is Barry Bonds building a case for collusion?2010-09-112009-03-19[[Sports Illustrated]]McCann, Michaelyeshttps://web.archive.org/20090321003604/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com:80/2009/writers/michael_mccann/03/16/bonds.collusion/index.html21 March 2009If he had returned to Major League Baseball, Bonds would have been within close range of several significant hitting milestones: needing just 65 hits to reach 3,000, 4 runs batted in to reach 2,000, and 38 home runs to reach 800. He would have needed 69 moreruns scoredto move pastRickey Hendersonas the all-time runs champion, and 37extra base hitsto move pastHank Aaronas the all-time extra base hits champion.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBonds won't return with Giants for '08, team confirms[[ESPN.com]]2007-09-222007-09-24

Sports]]2009-11-132009-11-13On December 9, however, Borris told theSan Francisco Chroniclethat Bonds has played his last major league game.cite newsJohnSheaBonds' agent concedes playing days are over2009-12-10http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f[[San Francisco Chronicle]]2009-12-10https://web.archive.org/web/20091213113544/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f13 December 2009noBonds announced on April 11, 2010 that he was proud of McGwire for admitting his use of steroids. Bonds said that it was not the time to retire, but he noted that he was not in shape to play immediately if an interested club called him.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBonds has kind words for McGwire2010-09-092010-04-12ESPN.com

There have been calls by fans of both the Pirates and Giants to retire their respectiveUniform number (Major League Baseball)uniform numbersheld by Bonds.cite newshttp://www.post-gazette.com/sports/columnists/20021019madden1019p1.aspPittsburgh Post-GazetteMadden: Bonds should be honored here2002-10-19cite webhttp://www.sfgiantsbaseball.net/sf-giants-retired-numbers/san-francisco-giants-retired-numbersSan Francisco Giants Retired Numbers | San Francisco Giants Baseball (SF Giants Rumors)Sfgiantsbaseball.net2009-09-292013-08-04However, Bonds has not had a jersey number retired by either team. His number 24 with the Pirates remains in circulation, most prominently worn byBrian Gilesfrom 1999 to 2003; it is currently worn byPedro Alvarez (baseball)Pedro Alvarez. The Giants have not reissued Bonds' number 25 since he left the team.

On December 15, 2011, Bonds was sentenced to 30 days of house arrest, two years of probation and 250 hours of community service, for an obstruction of justice conviction stemming from a grand jury appearance in 2003. However, U.S. District JudgeSusan Illstonthen delayed the sentence pending an appeal.cite newshttp://www.cbc.ca/sports/baseball/mlb/story/2011/12/16/sp-mlb-bonds-sentencing.htmlBarry Bonds gets 30 days house arrest, appeal pending[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]]2011-12-162011-12-19cite webhttp://espn.go.com/mlb/story/_/id/7360235/barry-bonds-sentenced-two-years-probation-30-days-house-arrestJudge stays Barry Bonds' sentence[[ESPN]]2011-12-182011-12-19In 2013 his conviction was upheld on appeal by a three judge panel of theUnited States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.cite newshttp://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/mlb/2013/09/13/barry-bonds-obstruction-of-justice-conviction-upheld/2809745/USA TODAY SportsBarry Bonds' obstruction conviction upheld2013-09-13However, the full court later granted Bonds anen bancrehearing, and on April 22, 2015, an 11-judge panel of the Ninth Circuit voted 10-1 to overturn his conviction.

On March 10, 2014, Bonds began a seven-day stint as a rovingSpring Traininginstructor for theSan Francisco GiantsGiants.cite webCapleJimBarry Bonds all smiles with Giantshttp://espn.go.com/mlb/story/_/id/10584326/barry-bonds-back-san-francisco-giants-new-role12 March 201410 March 2014[[ESPN]]
article.heading: Controversies
BALCO scandal
article.paragraph: File:Barry bonds mug shot 1.jpgrightthumb150pxMug shot taken after 2007 indictmentSince 2003, Bonds has been a key figure in the Bay Area Laboratory Co-operative (Bay Area Laboratory Co-operativeBALCO) scandal. He was under investigation by a federalgrand juryregarding his testimony in the BALCO case, and was indicted onperjuryandobstruction of justicecharges on November 15, 2007.cite newshttp://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/fc/Sports/drugs_in_sports/news_stories/SIGBarry Bonds indicted[[Associated Press]]2007-11-152007-11-15yeshttps://web.archive.org/20110721090718/http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/fc/Sports/drugs_in_sports/news_stories/SIG21 July 2011The indictment alleges that Bonds lied while under oath about his alleged use ofsteroids.cite newshttp://cdn.sfgate.com/chronicle/acrobat/2007/11/16/barrybondsindictment.pdfPDFBarry Bonds indictment[[San Francisco Chronicle]]2007-11-152007-11-15https://web.archive.org/web/20071117084656/http://cdn.sfgate.com/chronicle/acrobat/2007/11/16/barrybondsindictment.pdf17 November 2007noDead linkJuly 2012

In 2003, Bonds first became embroiled in a scandal whenGreg Anderson (trainer)Greg Andersonof theBALCOBay Area Laboratory Co-operative(BALCO), Bonds' trainer since 2000, was indicted by a federalgrand juryin theUnited States District Court for the Northern District of Californiaand charged with supplyinganabolic steroidsto athletes, including a number of baseball players. This led to speculation that Bonds had used performance-enhancing drugs during a time when there was no mandatory testing in Major League Baseball. Bonds declared his innocence, attributing his changed physique and increased power to a strict regimen of bodybuilding, diet and legitimate supplements.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBonds testified that substances didn't work2008-02-202004-12-04ESPN.comhttps://web.archive.org/web/20080120163542/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id20 January 2008no

During grand jury testimony on December 4, 2003,Bonds said that he used a clear substance and a cream that he received from his personal strength trainer, Greg Anderson, who told him they were the nutritional supplement flaxseed oil and a rubbing balm for arthritis.cite newshttp://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?fileWhat Bonds told BALCO grand jury2004-12-032007-10-10[[San Francisco Chronicle]]Williams, Lance, Mark Fainaru-Wadahttps://web.archive.org/web/20071118085803/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file18 November 2007noThis testimony, as reported byLance WilliamsandMark Fainaru-Wada, has frequently been misrepresented. Later reports on Bonds' leaked grand-jury testimony contend that he admitted to unknowingly using "the cream" and "Tetrahydrogestrinonethe clear".

In July 2005, all four defendants in the BALCO steroid scandal trial, including Anderson, struck deals with federal prosecutors that did not require them to reveal names of athletes who may have used banned drugs.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f40 of 42 BALCO charges dropped – Steroid lab owner, Bonds' trainer guilty in plea deal[[San Francisco Chronicle]]2005-07-162008-02-20Fainaru-Wada, Mark and Lance Williams
article.heading: Perjury investigation and federal indictment
article.paragraph: mainBarry Bonds perjury caseOn November 15, 2007, Bonds was indicted on four counts ofperjuryand one count ofobstruction of justiceas it relates to the government investigation of BALCO.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7097583.stmBaseball star Barry Bonds chargedBBC News2007-11-162008-02-15https://web.archive.org/web/20080226225527/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/7097583.stm26 February 2008no

On February 14, 2008 atypoin court papers filed by Federal prosecutors erroneously alleged that Bonds tested positive for steroids in November, 2001, a month after hitting his record 73rd home run. The reference was meant instead to refer to a November 2000 test that had already been disclosed and previously reported.cite newshttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idU.S. filing typo spurs erroneous Bonds drug reportESPN.com2008-02-152008-02-15https://web.archive.org/web/20080218131536/http://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?id18 February 2008noThe typo sparked a brief media frenzy.cite newshttp://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,330742,00.htmlCourt Document Typo Spurs Erroneous Bonds Drug Allegation[[Fox News]]2008-02-152010-09-10

His trial for obstruction of justice was to have begun on March 2, 2009, but jury selection was postponed due to 11th-hour appeals by the prosecution.cite newshttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBonds trial faces long delay for appeal2009-06-04ESPN.comMark Fainaru-WadaThe trial commenced on March 21, 2011, in U. S. District Court, Northern District of California, with Judge Susan Illston presiding.cite newshttp://customwire.ap.org/dynamic/stories/B/BBO_BONDS_TRIALBarry Bonds perjury trial gets under way2011-03-212011-03-21Associated PressElias, PaulHe was convicted on April 13, 2011 on the obstruction of justice charge, for giving an evasive answer to a question under oath.His sentence did not include prison. The conviction was initially upheld by a three judge panel of theUnited States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuitin 2013,but a larger panel of the court overturned the conviction on April 22, 2015.
article.heading: Players' Union
article.paragraph: Bonds withdrew from theMajor League Baseball Players AssociationMLB Players Association's (MLBPA)licenselicensingagreement because he felt independent marketing deals would be more lucrative for him. Bonds is the first player in the thirty-year history of the licensing program not to sign.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBonds will be individually licensed2008-02-20ESPN.com2003-11-17Rovell, DarrenBecause of this withdrawal, his name and likeness are not usable in any merchandise licensed by the MLBPA. In order to use his name or likeness, a company must deal directly with Bonds. For this reason he does not appear in some baseballvideo games, forcing game-makers to create generic athletes to replace him. For example, Bonds is replaced by "Jon Dowd" inMVP Baseball 2005.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/sportsbusiness/news/story?idBonds flexes his muscles2010-09-11ESPN.comRovell, Darren2007-04-07

mainGame of ShadowsIn March 2006 the bookGame of Shadows, written byLance Williams and Mark Fainaru-Wada, was released amid a storm of media publicity including the cover ofSports Illustrated.cite webhttp://dynamic.si.cnn.com/si_online/covers/issues/2006/0313.htmlSI Cover Search2008-02-20[[SI.com]]yeshttps://web.archive.org/20070612080222/http://dynamic.si.cnn.com/si_online/covers/issues/2006/0313.html12 June 2007Initially small excerpts of the book were released by the authors in the issue ofSports Illustrated. The book alleges Bonds usedstanozololand a host of other steroids, and is perhaps most responsible for the change in public opinion regarding Bonds' steroid use.cite newshttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2006/magazine/03/06/growth0313/The Truth About Barry Bonds and Steroids[[SI.com]]2008-02-20Fainaru-Wada, Mark and Lance Williamshttps://web.archive.org/web/20080331145109/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2006/magazine/03/06/growth0313/31 March 2008nocite newshttp://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/23/books/23kaku.html?_rBarry Bonds and Baseball's Steroids Scandal2008-02-20[[New York Times]]2006-03-23Kakutani, Michikohttps://web.archive.org/web/20080112040755/http://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/23/books/23kaku.html?_r12 January 2008no

The book contained excerpts of grand jury testimony that is supposed to be sealed and confidential by law. The authors have been steadfast in their refusal to divulge their sourcescite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/news/story?id'Game of Shadows' authors are subpoenaed2008-02-202006-05-06ESPN.comand at one point faced jail time.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/news/story?idReporters who refused to reveal BALCO leak get prison2006-09-222010-08-12ESPN.comOn February 14, 2007, Troy Ellerman, one ofVictor Conte's lawyers, pled guilty to leaking grand jury testimony. Through the plea agreement, he will spend two and a half years in jail.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/mlb/news/story?idBALCO leaker Ellerman gets 2½ years in prison2008-02-202007-07-12ESPN.com

In May 2006, formerSports IllustratedwriterJeff Pearlmanreleased a revealing biography of Bonds entitledLove Me, Hate Me: Barry Bonds and the Making of an Anti-Hero.The book also contained many allegations against Bonds.cite newshttp://www.post-gazette.com/pg/06099/680058-148.stm'Love Me, Hate Me: Barry Bonds and the Making of an Antihero' by Jeff Pearlman2008-02-20[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]2006-04-09Caroulis, JonThe book, which describes Bonds as a polarizing insufferable braggart with a legendary ego and staggering ability, relied on over five hundred interviews, except with Bonds himself.cite webhttp://www.harpercollins.com/books/9780061191923/Love_Me_Hate_Me/index.aspxLove Me, Hate Me2008-02-20HarperCollins

mainBonds on BondsIn April 2006 and May 2006,ESPNaired a few episodes of a 10-partreality TV(unscripted,documentary filmdocumentary-style) series starring Bonds.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f'Bonds on Bonds' – You'll love him or hate him: At turns sickening, redeeming, it might be essential viewing2008-04-172006-04-05Goodman, Tim[[San Francisco Chronicle]]cite webhttp://mlb.mlb.com/news/article.jsp?ymdBonds to star in documentary series2008-04-172006-03-01Bloom, Barry M.[[MLB.com]]The show, titledShows on ESPN#Original SeriesBonds on Bonds, focused on Bonds' chase ofBabe Ruth's andHank Aaron'shome runrecords. Some felt the show should be put on hiatus until baseball investigated Bonds' steroid use allegations.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/columns/story?columnistESPN should put 'Bonds on Bonds' on hold2008-04-172006-03-14ESPN.comSolomon, GeorgeThe series was canceled in June 2006, ESPN and producer Tollin/Robbins Productions citing "creative control" issues with Bonds and his representatives.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/sfgate/category?blogidBonds Goes Boneyard2008-04-172006-06-02Goodman, Tim[[San Francisco Chronicle]]https://web.archive.org/web/20080410134233/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/sfgate/category?blogid2008-04-10cite webhttp://www.mediaweek.com/mw/news/cabletv/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_idhttps://web.archive.org/web/20070612082520/http://www.mediaweek.com/mw/news/cabletv/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id2007-06-12ESPN's Bonds On Bonds Pulled2008-04-172006-05-25[[Media Week]]Consoli, John

On January 10, 1998, Bonds married his second wife, Liz Watson, at the San FranciscoRitz-CarltonHotel in front of 240 guests.The couple lived inLos Altos Hills, California, with their daughter Aishacite webhttp://www.losaltoshills.com/people/Los Altos Hills People2008-04-17Los Altos Hills.comhttp://web.archive.org/web/20080509052515/http://www.losaltoshills.com/people/9 May 2008noduring their ten and a half years of marriage before Watson filed for Legal Separation on June 9, 2009, citingirreconcilable differences.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/sports/article/Bonds-wife-files-for-separation-3228441.phpBonds' wife files for separation2009-06-292009-06-09Williams, Lance[[San Francisco Chronicle]]http://web.archive.org/web/20090612035048/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f12 June 2009noOn July 21, 2009, just six weeks later, Watson announced that she was withdrawing her Legal Separation action.cite newshttp://www.thehollywoodgossip.com/2009/07/liz-watson-files-to-end-separation-with-barry-bonds/Liz Watson Files to End Separation with Barry Bonds2009-07-212013-03-31The Hollywood GossipThe couple were reconciled for seven months before Watson formally filed for divorce inLos Angeles, Californiaon February 26, 2010.cite newshttp://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?fBarry Bonds' wife files for divorce in LA[[The San Francisco Chronicle]]yeshttps://web.archive.org/20100609185409/http://www.sfgate.com:80/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f9 June 2010On June 6, 2011, Bonds and Watson filed a legal agreement not to take the divorce to trial and instead settle it in an "uncontested manner", effectively agreeing to take the proceedings out of the public eye and end the marriage privately at an unspecified later date without further court involvement.cite newshttp://radaronline.com/exclusives/2010/06/exclusive-barry-bonds-moves-one-step-closer-divorce/EXCLUSIVE: Barry Bonds Moves One Step Closer To Divorce2013-03-312010-06-08[[Radar Online]]

article.heading: Career distinctions
article.paragraph: Besides holding Major League career records in home runs (762), walks (2,558), and intentional walks (688), at the time of his retirement, Bonds also led all active players in RBI (1,996),on-base percentage(.444), runs (2,227), games (2,986), extra-base hits (1,440), at-bats per home run (12.92), andtotal bases(5,976). He is 2nd in doubles (601), slugging percentage (.607), stolen bases (514), at-bats (9,847), and hits (2,935), 6th in triples (77), 8th in sacrifice flies (91), and 9th instrikeouts(1,539), through September 26, 2007.

Bonds is the lone member of the 500500 club, which means he has hit at least 500 home runs (762) and stolen 500 bases (514). He is also one of only four baseball players all-time to be in the 4040 club (1996), which means he hit 40 home runs (42) and stole 40 bases (40) in the same season; the other members areJos Canseco,Alex RodriguezandAlfonso Soriano.
